Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "Schindler's List". This film tells the story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman during World War II. He notices that his Jewish workers are being targeted by the Nazis and decides to protect them instead.

The film stars Liam Neeson as Schindler, Ben Kingsley as Amon Goetz, Ralph Fiennes as Oskar Schindler's nephew, and Thomas Keel as a Jewish SS officer.

"Schindler's List" won three Oscars, including Best Picture, and is widely regarded as one of the greatest films ever made.
